channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Families accuse Camp Mystic of ignoring risks in Texas lawsuit over flood deaths
item.description: The families of some of the 25 girls and two teenage counselors who died in catastrophic flooding in Texas on July 4 are suing Camp Mystic and its own...

item.title: Senate approves shutdown ending legislation, sending bill to the House for a vote
item.description: After 41 days of a government shutdown, the U.S. Senate has passed a set of bills to reopen the government. Its fate in the House is uncertain.

item.title: Gregory Bovino and Border Patrol agents plan to leave Chicago area, sources say
item.description: Some Border Patrol agents could soon leave the Chicago area, after taking a leading role in the Trump administration's controversial immigration opera...

item.title: Syria to join US-led coalition to defeat IS group after Trump meeting
item.description: Ahmed al-Sharaa, once branded a terrorist by the US, became the first Syrian leader to visit the White House.

item.title: Senate approves package to end government shutdown, sending to House
item.description: The Senate approved a long-sought funding package that would end the government shutdown late Monday, bringing Congress one step closer to ending a 41...

item.title: Doctor unpacks FDA's removal of "black box" warnings on some menopause hormone therapies
item.description: The FDA says it will remove the "black box" warning labels on many hormone therapy drugs used to treat menopause and perimenopause. Dr. Tami Rowen, an...

item.title: AI scams fuel rise in fake online car sales. How California is trying to protect consumers.
item.description: Buying a car is one of the biggest purchases we make, and more people are turning to online marketplaces for deals on used cars. But thanks to artific...

item.title: 11/10: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Some Democrats are frustrated after colleagues crossed the aisle to end the shutdown; Texas Gov. Greg Abbott announces a bid for a fourth term.

item.title: Prominent Afrikaners refuse to be 'pawns,' and hit back at Trump's claims about South Africa
item.description: Prominent Afrikaners are pushing back after President Trump announced no U.S. officials will attend the G20 in Johannesburg, rejecting his claims of "...

item.title: Shopping for an Affordable Care Act health plan? NPR wants to hear your experience
item.description: If you buy your own health insurance through the ACA marketplaces, how do this year's prices look to you?

item.title: Public safety groups face an uncertain future months after federal grant cuts
item.description: Six months after the Trump administration cut more than $800 million in Justice Department grants geared toward public safety, the organizations affec...

item.title: Families accuse Camp Mystic of ignoring risks in Texas lawsuit over flood deaths
Ros Atkins on... the BBC resignations
item.description: The BBC's Analysis Editor Ros Atkins looks at the resignations of BBC bosses - and how this crisis didn't come out of nowhere.

item.title: Gaddafi's youngest son released after 10 years in Lebanese detention
item.description: The Lebanese authorities seized Mr Gaddafi, now 49, in 2015 and held him without trial.

item.title: Canada loses its measles-free status, with US on track to follow
item.description: The country hasn't been able to curb an outbreak of more than 5,000 cases over the last year, while US cases are at a 33-year high.

item.title: Supreme Court rejects call to overturn its decision legalizing same-sex marriage nationwide
item.description: The Supreme Court has rejected a call to overturn its landmark decision that legalized same-sex marriage nationwide.

item.title: Deployment of West Virginia National Guard members in nationâ€™s capital can continue, judge allows
At least eight killed after car explodes near Delhi's Red Fort
item.description: Twenty more were injured in the blast, the cause of which is still unknown, authorities say.
